description.narrative: Support to YUS Conservation Area - YUS Conservation Area is dedicated to conserving and expanding habitat of the endangered Matschie’s tree kangaroo (

activity-description.narrative: YUS Conservation Area is a protected area on the Huon Peninsula, Morobe Province

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1. Capacity Development Indicator score for Morobe and TKCP. 2. Extent of area under different National PA Categories and covered by Integrated Land Use Plans to direct management. 3. Stable or increased populations of threatened species in YUS Conservation Area. 4. Increased productivity of organic coffee and cocoa in existing agricultural zones in YUS. 5. Formal agreements in place between communities in participating Government/ project IAs, to provide financial and in-kind support to additional resources per household participating communities, resulting in additional resources per household.

comment.narrative: Capacity scorecard: Morobe Provincial Government at 27% and Tree Kangaroo Conservation Program is 62% YUS Community Conservation Area currently at 76,000 ha Est. Matschie‘s Tree Kangaroo (Dendrolagus matschiei) population at 250 + Produced Coffee at 2.5 tons per year (from 22,650 ha.) and Cocoa at 38.6 tons per year (from 6,091 ha.) Additional income of US$ 50 per household by coffee and cocoa producers

1- TKCP, YUS CA communities, Rangers and Provincial Government Officials training on Protected Area 2- Capacity Development Training Plan Develop Awareness, education and advocacy 3- Material progress monitoring and Reporting Schedule in place. 4- Revised YUS ca LANDSCAPE plan 2016-2020 printed and distributed 5- Pilot ward level 3D modeling project 6- Evaluate ecological monitoring and reporting tool (SMART) for YUS CA 7- Develop Three Kangaroo Research Strategic Plan 8- community monitoring plan developed 9- enforce YUS CA by laws 10 - 3 tonnes organic coffeee (green beans) exported from YUS 11- 1 tonne organic cocoa exported from YUS.

Among communities, UNDP’s efforts have resulted in over 100 Rangers and 16 Research Officers being trained, the use of GPS mapping and other emerging technologies to improve conservation efforts, for example, mobile apps and thermal imaging, new partnerships with international institutions such as the Bishop Museum to strengthen biodiversity surveying and the cataloguing of new species previously thought absent from some of these conservation sites, among them, the red-crested bird of paradise.
UNDP’s work saw communities benefit from growing green commodity opportunities. In the YUS mountain range, approx. 400 families benefited from sustainable coffee production. Covering 28 villages, approx. 30 tonnes of coffee was sold to international buyers Caffe Vita (Seattle, USA) and Jasper Coffee (Melbourne, Australia). This generated over $275,000 in revenue and increased profits for farmers by approx. 176,000 Kina.

Activity (Output 2.1): Expansion to the landscape level and effective management of the YUS Conservation Area Support to YUS Conservation Areas Targets: 1. Gazettal of YUS Conservation Area at the Landscape Level. 2. Community-based Land-use Management strengthened and incorporated into YUS Landscape Management 3. YUS Conservation Organization (CBO) capacity strengthened and participation in YUS CA management activities increased 4. Improved collection, reporting and application of YUS CA patrol/monitoring data utilizing SMART technology 5.Training for TKCP, Rangers, and YUS Communities on Protected Area Management. 6. Develop and Distribute Awareness, Education and Advocacy Materials
Targets: 1. TKCP & YUS Conservation Area Strategic Plan 2020 - 2025. 2. Participatory 3D Modelling completed for all zones; 3D Models serve as community resources for land-use planning and management. 3. Pilot and review community-based land-use monitoring to support community landscape management. 4. Matschies tree kangaroo distribution model and ecology /behavior insights. 5. Special Monitoring and Reporting Tool (SMART) system for YUS CA strengthened; patrol data applied for adaptive management and reporting through YUS Conservation Area Management Committee.
Activity (Output 2.4): Community Livelihood Assistance in the YUS Conservation Area. Targets: 1. >10 tonnes of YUS Conservation Coffee parchment exported from YUS 2. >1 tonne YUS Conservation Cocoa exported from YUS 3. YUS Conservation Cocoa Business Plan completed and implemented to support production recovery and rehabilitation. 4. Management Capacity of YUS Conservation Coffee & Cocoa Cooperative Strengthened and participation in community enterprise increase

The target was achieved for the re-gazettal of the expanded YUS Landscape for an additional 84,683 ha making the YUS Landscape total area of 162,683 ha. A newly appointed YUS CBO Advisor was engaged by the TKCP and is funded by the Kabwum District Administration. WPZ/TKCP also completed their Landscape Land Use planning workshop that culminated in the updated Land Use Plan for the Landscape. Livelihood activities around coffee and cocoa continued and coffee exports freight subsidies have been supported by the Morobe Provincial Administration. The YUS Team provided the UNDP story on their Junior Ranger Program and this was published on the World Ranger Day. In addition the same story was also included in the UNDP Newsletter series around the same time mid-year and on the UN Youth Day.
